Views Compound components that consist of a group of existing controls

Grid Table Grid Table on tablet and Object Cell on phone.
Grid Table(XML) With Sticky Header A different flavor of Grid Table with sticky header and columns declared in XML.
Grid Table/Object Cell Auto Conversion Grid Table on tablet and Object Cell on phone using single layout and adapter.
Object Cell Icon/Image Container Icon and detail image are put into a container that remains the same width.
Dynamic lines Object Cell Number of lines are determined by content dynamically.
1-line Object Cell 1-line height/1 status/no action/do not preserve description spacing.
1-line Object Cell Without Detail Image 1-line height/1 status/no action/no detail image.
2-line Object Cell 2-line height/2 statuses/no action/less data.
Object Cell Display Variant 3-line headline and description/ONLY makes sense for tablet.
Object Cell Dynamic Status Width Status width varies from cell to cell.
Object Cell With Chinese Character No xml layout/Chinese characters.
Object Cell With Data Binding Databinding/customized text appearance/round avatar.
Collection View Collection View
No demo apps available at this time
Object Cells Key Items See All
Object Cell Preview List Partial data with header and footer. Use list on phone and grid on tablet.
Attention Protected Not protected
Object Header A quick view of the most important about an object.
Standard Object Header Headline/additional info/analytics/status
This is a title on the first line Job 000001 3475 Deer Creek Rd, Palo Alto Due on 12/31/16 Started PM01 103-Repair Temperature sensor predicts overheating failure in 4 days. Urgent and needs attention. Follow standard protocol for inspecting and repairing equipment in critical condition. High Object Header Image
Image An image helps the user to visually identify the object. Character Image A character image placeholder in case image is missing. Sub Headline Optional information about the object under headline. Detail A detail view can be plugged in for user to quickly understand relevant trend. Description A description paragraph can be optionally included, which does not exceed four lines, and provides the user with valuable information. Tags Tags are usually system-generated and may be used to indicate categories, types, or statuses. Max 3. Body Additional information below Tags and above footnote. Footnote The footnote provides important information that can be consumed quickly (e.g., location, date, and time details). Status A status section displays the current status of the object. Menu 1 Menu 2
Contact Cell Gives quick access to the various methods of communicating with a contact. Not implemented yet.
Profile Header Client The profile header helps the user recognize and learn more about a person. It may also allow the user to quickly contact that person without needing to drill down into his/her contact details. Alex Smith\'s Image Michael Adams Michael Adams Long Name Example Senior Consultant Next 1:1 in 6 days\n3 Recent Updates, 1 Urgent One line of description Start 1:1 End 1:1 Profile Action Profile Image Show profile image. Highly recommended. Profile image placeholder. Profile Name Long name will wrap into 2 lines if necessary. Short name Profile Title Show profile title Do not show profile title Contact Action Icons Number of contact action icons: %s 2 (Minimum value) 5 (Maximum value) Profile Action Show profile action. (Hides contact action icons) Do not show profile action START 1:1 END 1:1 Profile Description One line of description Two line of description
Key/Value Cell A list item that shows a label and a value. 3-line Key/Value Cell 3 lines of value text. 2-line Key/Value Cell 2 lines of value text. 1-line Key/Value Cell 1 line of value text. 1 to 2 lines 2-column(tablet) Key/Value Cell On tablet 2 columns of Key/Value Cells. On phone 1 column. Non-expandable. Dynamic Key/Value Cell 1 to 6 lines of collapsed value text. Key/Value Cell with actionable value Phone number as the value.
